traumatic encephalopathy encephalo
chronic traumatic encephalopathy whew
that's a mouthful let's just call it CTE
Ct is a brain disorder the symptoms
include memory loss depression and
aggressive or violent behavior some
high-profile athletes like boxers and FL
players and professional wrestlers have
been getting diagnosed with CTE the
trouble is that the diagnosis came after
they were already dead that's when a
pathologists can slice open the brain
and find the tell-tale signs of CTE
doctors might be able to intervene
though if CTE could be diagnosed while
persons still alive so researchers are
now starting up long term studies of
athletes plus people like military
veterans involved in repetitive bomb
blasts a major part of the studies will
be brain scans for two reasons one
scientists can look at structural
changes in the brain over time and two
they can look for a hallmark of CTE
something called aggregated tau protein
now tau protein helps stabilize
scaffolding of nerve cells when a person
gets knocked in the head tau protein
breaks off from the scaffolding
neuroscientists aren't sure why that
happens but they do know that tau clumps
together and then nerve cells start to
malfunction and when tower grits spread
throughout the brain nerve cells die so
researchers want to see these Tigra
gates while persons still alive so
they're designing small molecules that
stick to the tiny clumps these molecules
emit what's called positron radiation
which can be picked up on a scanner in
this way scientists can map tile
formation in the brain and they can get
an idea of who might be developing CTE
before symptoms show up doctors still
don't know who's susceptible to CTE how
many times a person needs to get hit in
